Expectation1: Design and develop technical solutions to meet project requirements
Situation1: The build is stalled because no one can proceed until their core module is complete
Situation2: They counsel a person in crisis whose decisions could have serious moral or personal consequences.
Story: I stared at the blinking cursor on my screen, the code for the core module half-finished. My phone buzzed again—another message from the project manager, reminding me that the entire build was waiting on my piece. The pressure was mounting; every hour I delayed, the team’s frustration grew. I knew the technical solution was within reach if I could just focus, but my mind kept drifting to the call I’d received earlier. A member of my congregation was in crisis, desperate for guidance, their voice trembling with fear and uncertainty. They needed me to listen, to help them navigate a decision that could change the course of their life. I felt the weight of both worlds pressing in—one demanding my expertise and speed, the other my compassion and presence. My hands hovered over the keyboard, heart pounding, torn between the urgent needs of my team and the deep responsibility I felt for someone’s soul.
